content.title: Goa (Technical/ Vocational Training To Sex Workers And Sexually Abused Women) Scheme, 2013 (PRABHAT)
content.department: Department of Women and Child Development
content.beneficiary: Sex Workers and Sexually Abused Women
content.details: The 'Goa (Technical/ Vocational Training to Sex Workers and Sexually Abused Women) Scheme, 2013 (PRABHAT)' provides technical/vocational training for sex workers and sexually abused women to enable them to earn for their livelihood through such technical/vocational training and skill. The department will take the assistance of members of reputed NGOs/Trust/Society/professionals/expert bodies, who are involved in the rehabilitation of sex workers.
benefits: Financial Assistance: â‚¹ 2,500/- per month for three months or until joining a livelihood programme.
Technical/Vocational Training: Assistance in joining training programmes with covered fees and expenses.
Education: Support for education up to 12th Standard.
Shelter: Admission to shelter homes if needed.
Psycho-Social Services: Counseling provided by professionals.
Health: Health services for all ailments at Government hospitals.
Children: Counseling and assistance for children's education.
Reintegration: Support in reintegrating with family and community.
Protection: Assistance in ensuring safety from traffickers.
Livelihood: Help in finding jobs or setting up businesses.
eligibility: The applicant should be Women and Children who are victims of Commercial Sexual Exploitation.
The applicant should be either residing in Goa or be a native of Goa.
content.application_process: Offline. Steps include visiting the Probation Officer, filling out the application form, attaching required documents, and submitting it.

faqs.question: Could You Elaborate On The Role And Significance Of The Monitoring Committee In Ensuring The Effective Implementation Of The Sex Workers Rehabilitation Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Monitoring Committee oversees the scheme's execution, ensuring support reaches sex workers. Regular interactions assess progress and effectiveness.

faqs.question: Can You Provide More Details About The Members Constituting The Monitoring Committee And The Expertise They Bring To Support Sex Workers?
faqs.answer: Committee members include the Director of Women and Child Development, social workers with expertise in rehabilitation, police officials for legal support, a doctor for mental health, a business representative, and victim representatives.

faqs.question: How Often Does The Monitoring Committee Meet, And Why Is Meeting Within A Week Of Receiving Applications Important?
faqs.answer: Meetings are held as needed. Meeting promptly within a week ensures timely assistance to sex workers seeking rehabilitation.
